title: President Anura Kumara meets Indian PM Narendra Modi in New Delhi
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has met with Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi at the Bharat Mandapam in New Delhi yesterday (19).

title: Defence Ministry reaffirms commitment to welfare of veterans
byline: The Ministry of Defence has reaffirmed its unwavering commitment to the ensuring welfare of veterans during its Public Day program, held at the Ministry premises.

title: Fairly heavy rainfall above 75 mm expected in parts of the island today
byline: Showers will occur at times in Uva, Central and Eastern provinces and in Polonnaruwa district.

title: Fonseka urges President to pardon those sentenced to death over Amarakeerthi killing
byline: The former Commander of the Sri Lanka Army, Field Marshal Sarath Fonseka has made a special request to the President to grant a pardon to the individuals who were sentenced to death over the killing of former Member of Parliament Amarakeerthi Athukorala and his security officer.

title: President to address ‘AI Impact Summit 2026’ in Delhi today
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake is scheduled to address the ‘AI Impact Summit 2026’ in Delhi today.

title: Do not give away Diego Garcia, Trump tells UK in fresh attack on Chagos deal
byline: “Do not give away Diego Garcia,” US President Donald Trump has said as he criticised the UK’s plan to hand over the Chagos Islands to Mauritius and lease back an important military base.

title: Rs. 556 million worth of technical equipment handed over to police
byline: A stock of essential technical equipment worth Rs. 556 million has been provided to the Police Department by the Minister of Public Security and Parliamentary Affairs, Ananda Wijepala.

title: UK Deputy PM David Lammy concludes official visit to Sri Lanka
byline: The Deputy Prime Minister of the United Kingdom, David Lammy, has concluded his official visit to Sri Lanka yesterday (18).

title: Five nabbed over expressway incident in Mattala remanded
byline: Five individuals arrested over attempting to enter the Southern Expressway from the Mattala Exit in a bus without seat belts and for obstructing police duties have been remanded by the Hambantota Magistrate’s Court.

title: Court sets date to hear Namal Rajapaksa’s case over ‘Krrish’ deal
byline: The Colombo High Court has scheduled the hearing of the case filed against Member of Parliament Namal Rajapaksa in connection with the controversial ‘Krrish’ project deal on April 02, 2026.

title: Taylor Swift named best-selling artist of the year for sixth time
byline: Taylor Swift was 2025’s best-selling global artist of the year, the IFPI said on Wednesday (Feb 18), marking the sixth time she won the title from the organisation that represents the recorded music industry.

title: Minimum electricity tariff will increase under new National Electricity Policy: Champika Ranawaka
byline: The minimum electricity tariff will increase with the introduction of the new National Electricity Policy, former Minister Patali Champika Ranawaka stated.

title: Australia bans citizen trying to return from IS camp in Syria
byline: Australia has barred a citizen linked to the Islamic State (IS) group from the country for up to two years.

title: Tech firms will have 48 hours to remove abusive images under new law
byline: Tech platforms would have to remove intimate images which have been shared without consent within 48 hours, under a proposed UK law.

title: Ukraine’s officials to boycott Paralympics over Russian flag decision
byline: Ukrainian officials will boycott the Paralympic Winter Games, Kyiv said on Wednesday, after the International Paralympic Committee allowed Russian athletes to compete under their national flag.

title: Special traffic plan near Premadasa stadium from noon
byline: A special security program and traffic plan will be implemented by Sri Lanka Police in view of the Sri Lanka–Zimbabwe T20 World Cup encounter to be played at the R. Premadasa International Cricket Stadium in Colombo this afternoon.

title: Tech firms will have 48 hours to remove abusive images under new UK law
byline: Tech platforms would have to remove intimate images which have been shared without consent within 48 hours, under a proposed UK law.

title: Sufficient stocks of LP gas secured; no need for panic buying - Litro
byline: Litro Gas Lanka Limited has issued a special statement is to address recent concerns regarding a temporary shortage of LP gas cylinders in the market, and to assure the public that sufficient stocks have been secured and that there is no need for panic buying.

title: Heavy rains hit Batticaloa, several roads inundated
byline: Heavy rains have been reported in the Batticaloa District in recent days affecting day-to-day activities of the residents.

title: Former CID Officer expresses regret over arrest of Nathasha Edirisooriya under ICCPR Act
byline: A former Officer-in-Charge of the Computer Crimes Investigation Division of the Criminal Investigation Department today expressed regret before the Supreme Court over the arrest of comedian Nathasha Edirisooriya under the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights (ICCPR) Act, over allegations of insulting Buddhism.

title: South Korea court convicts ex-President Yoon for insurrection in martial law case
byline: A South Korean court on Thursday found former President Yoon Suk Yeol guilty of leading an insurrection during his botched attempt to place the country under martial law in December 2024.

title: Minimum electricity tariff will increase under new Electricity Policy: Champika Ranawaka
byline: The minimum electricity tariff will increase with the introduction of the new National Electricity Policy, former Minister Patali Champika Ranawaka stated.

title: South Korea’s ex-President Yoon sentenced to life in prison for insurrection
byline: A South Korean court on Thursday sentenced former President Yoon Suk Yeol to life in prison for leading an insurrection during his botched attempt to place the country under martial law in December 2024.

title: Zuckerberg defends Meta in landmark social media addiction trial
byline: Mark Zuckerberg, the boss of Instagram-owner Meta Platforms, struggled in court on Wednesday to defend his company from claims it targeted young users as he was confronted with multiple internal documents.

title: Over 300 drunk drivers arrested in daily police operations
byline: A total of 29,608 individuals were inspected yesterday (18) as part of the daily search operations carried out across the country, police stated.

title: U.S. Pacific Fleet Commander Admiral Koehler to visit Sri Lanka
byline: Admiral Steve “Web” Koehler, Commander of the U.S. Pacific Fleet, is scheduled to visit Sri Lanka from February 19 to February 21, 2026.

title: PM Harini reveals allowances and benefits of MPs
byline: Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya today revealed allowances and benefits provided to Members of Parliament at present.

title: Bill Gates a no-show at India AI summit, event marred by organisational chaos
byline: Bill Gates pulled out of India’s AI Impact Summit hours before his scheduled keynote address on Thursday, dealing another blow to a flagship event already marred by organisational lapses, a robot bungle and delegate complaints over traffic disruptions.

title: Sharp rise in rabies cases linked to cats, health officials warn
byline: A significant rise in rabies transmission from cats in Sri Lanka have been reported, according to health authorities.

title: Army Sergeant among 4 arrested over soldier’s death and cover-up at Kuttigala camp
byline: Sri Lanka Army Spokesman, Brigadier Waruna Gamage, says steps will be taken to suspend the Sergeant attached to the Kuttigala camp in Embilipitiya, who was remanded on charges of covering up the death of a soldier who died after coming into contact with an unauthorized power line at the camp.

title: Foreign nationals driving without valid licenses to be prosecuted - Sri Lanka Police
byline: Sri Lanka Police have warned that foreign nationals who drive without a valid driving license in the country will be prosecuted to ensure the safety of both visitors and local residents amid rising traffic accidents involving foreign nationals.

title: Canada revises express entry immigration rules, adds military roles
byline: Canada introduced new immigration priority categories on Wednesday to bring in skilled workers in fields ranging from research and health care to aviation, and to include certain military recruits.

title: King Charles’ brother Andrew arrested by police - British media
byline: A UK police force has arrested Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor on suspicion of misconduct in public office.

title: Trump kicks off his Board of Peace, with eye on Gaza and beyond
byline: United States President Donald Trump on Thursday (Feb 19) gathers allies to inaugurate the Board of Peace, his new institution focused on progress on Gaza but whose ambitions reach much further.

title: Sri Lanka still lacking infrastructure to gain maximum benefit of AI technology: President
byline: Sri Lanka still does not possess advanced infrastructure to gain maximum benefit of the AI technology, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake stated.

title: India’s Reliance to build AI data centres in $110 billion investment push
byline: India’s Reliance Industries and telecoms arm Jio will invest $109.8 billion over the next seven years to build artificial intelligence and data infrastructure, its billionaire chairman Mukesh Ambani said on Thursday.

title: AI infrastructure is next frontier of economic and cultural cooperation - President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake stated that Sri Lanka is prepared to share common values on artificial intelligence, ensuring that no one is left behind and to move forward collectively through mutual learning based on ethical principles.

title: CID probes 8 bank accounts linked to female lawyer remanded over ‘Ganemulla Sanjeewa’ murder
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) has informed the Colombo Magistrate’s Court that it is investigating eight bank accounts opened using forged documents allegedly by Attorney-at-Law Thamara Abeyratne, who was remanded in connection with the ‘Ganemulla Sanjeewa’ murder case.

title: 22 Indian fishermen arrested poaching in Sri Lankan waters
byline: The Sri Lanka Navy and Coast Guard have seized four Indian fishing boats and apprehended 22 Indian fishermen while they were poaching in Sri Lankan waters north of Mannar and off the Delft Island, Jaffna.

title: US Pacific Fleet Commander calls on Sri Lanka’s Defence Secretary, discuss maritime security
byline: The Commander of the United States Pacific Fleet, Admiral Stephen T. Koehler, has met with Sri Lanka’s Defence Secretary, Air Vice Marshal (Retd) Sampath Thuyacontha, at the Ministry of Defence today (19).

title: Indian Navy chief holds bilateral talks with Sri Lankan counterpart
byline: India’s Chief of the Naval Staff (CNS), Admiral Dinesh K. Tirpathi has had an interaction with the Commander of the Sri Lanka Vice Admiral Kanchana Banagoda on the sidelines of the International Fleet Review at Visakhapatnam on Wednesday.

title: LAUGFS Gas issues clarification, assures uninterrupted supply
byline: LAUGFS Gas PLC, one of the largest supplier of LP Gas in Sri Lanka, today issued statement to address recent concerns regarding the temporary shortage of its LP Gas cylinders in the market and to assure the public that necessary measures have been taken to ensure continued supply.

title: Fire breaks out in Sri Pada Reserve posing threat to biodiversity
byline: A forest fire has reportedly broken out today (19) on a mountain range within the Sri Pada Reserve located in front of the Sri Pada peak.

title: President Dissanayake holds bilateral talks with French President Macron
byline: A bilateral discussion between President Anura Kumara Dissanayake and President of France Emmanuel Macron took place this afternoon (19), according to the President’s Media Division.

title: President holds talks with Bhutan’s PM and Abu Dhabi’s Crown Prince
byline: A bilateral discussion between President Anura Kumara Dissanayake and the Crown Prince of Abu Dhabi, Sheikh Khaled bin Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan, was held this afternoon (19).

title: President Anura Kumara meets Brazilian President Lula in Delhi
byline: A bilateral discussion between President Anura Kumara Dissanayake and Brazilian President Lula da Silva was held this afternoon (19), according to the President’s Media Division.

title: King Charles says ‘law must take its course’ after Andrew arrest
byline: Britain’s King Charles III said Thursday “the law must take its course” after police arrested his brother, the former prince Andrew, on suspicion of misconduct when he was a trade envoy.
